contexts.context: ...of Fighters provides employment to free-swords and mercenaries and <mark>contracts</mark> to local citizens. Citizens may contract with the Guild for...
...swords and mercenaries and contracts to local citizens. Citizens may <mark>contract</mark> with the Guild for the removal of creatures and pests,...
Citizens who <mark>contract</mark> with the Guild of Fighters and have a dispute may appeal...
...dispute may appeal first to the Guild Steward who accepted the <mark>contract</mark> and second with the authorities of each Province.
...It is supposed that vampirism is <mark>contracted</mark> from wounds received from a vampire. Since few victims survive...
...few victims survive vampiric attacks or feedings, the process of <mark>contracting</mark> the disease is little understood. Some have suggested that victims...
...encounter with a vampire would be considered a deliberate attempt to <mark>contract</mark> the disease, and a mark of monstrous depravity....
